events.title: Epstein's Psychological Observation Update
events.description: Internal jail staff correspondence regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's psychological status and his complaints about cell conditions, including a toilet that ran for 45 minutes and numbness in his arm.

keyFacts: On July 28, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was reported as 'psychologically stable' but on 'Psych Observation' status in jail.
Epstein complained of physical issues including numbness in his right arm and neck, and an inability to make a fist with his right hand.
Epstein reported a cell toilet that ran for 45 minutes the previous night, which he found 'aversive and disorienting,' leading him to urinate in a cup to avoid it.
Jail staff discussed moving Epstein to another cell if the toilet issue persisted and noted he spent long hours (8 AM to 8 PM) in an Attorney Conference room.
